benchmark_details.name: CoverBench
benchmark_details.overview: CoverBench is a challenging benchmark focused on verifying language model outputs in complex reasoning settings, providing a diversified evaluation for complex claim verification in various domains with a consistent schema.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop models capable of verifying the correctness of complex claims made by large language models.

data.source: Based on a combination of nine diverse datasets designed for complex reasoning tasks.
data.annotation: Manual vetting and model-assisted transformation and validation.

methodology.calculation: Macro-F1 score is calculated based on the binary classification of claims against their grounding contexts.
methodology.interpretation: Scores closer to 70 indicate better performance, with performance below 50 indicating a random baseline.
methodology.baseline_results: Best models achieve below a 70 Macro-F1 score.
methodology.validation: Manual inspection of example solvability and label correctness.
